intro: Thymus haussknechtii, commonly known as the Balkan thyme, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are aromatic, with a strong thyme scent, and are often used in traditional herbal remedies. Thymus haussknechtii thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well adapted to rocky and dry environments.
